body_html:
here's the path for passing cla:
1.use google account, say wobushiliu2@gmail.com to register github,
and set a git name, say eigen2017.

2.goto https://cla.developers.google.com/clas to sign a agreement as "only self".
set "GitHub Account Name" to be wobushiliu2@gmail.com

3.jus fork a copy of tensor project and clone it to local:
➜ tensorflow git:(master) git remote -v
origin https://github.com/eigen2017/tensorflow (fetch)
origin https://github.com/eigen2017/tensorflow (push)

4.set name and email:
git config user.name "eigen2017"
git config user.email "wobushiliu2@gmail.com"
be care not to add "global" option, so the git configuration is only for ur fork project , not for other git project on your pc.

5.change the source code

  1. git add *
    git commit -m "..."
    git push origin master

  2. grab a pull req from https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pulls
    select: "compare across forks"
    select: your fork

  3. post the pull req
body_text:
here's the path for passing cla:
1.use google account, say wobushiliu2@gmail.com to register github,
and set a git name, say eigen2017.
2.goto https://cla.developers.google.com/clas to sign a agreement as "only self".
set "GitHub Account Name" to be wobushiliu2@gmail.com
3.jus fork a copy of tensor project and clone it to local:
➜  tensorflow git:(master) git remote -v
origin	https://github.com/eigen2017/tensorflow (fetch)
origin	https://github.com/eigen2017/tensorflow (push)
4.set name and email:
git config user.name "eigen2017"
git config user.email "wobushiliu2@gmail.com"
be care not to add "global" option, so the git configuration is only for ur fork project , not for other git project on your pc.
5.change the source code


git add *
git commit -m "..."
git push origin master


grab a pull req from https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pulls
select:  "compare across forks"
select: your fork


post the pull req
body:
here's the path for passing cla:
1.use google account, say wobushiliu2@gmail.com to register github, 
   and set a git name, say eigen2017.

2.goto https://cla.developers.google.com/clas to sign a agreement as "only self".
   set "GitHub Account Name" to be wobushiliu2@gmail.com

3.jus fork a copy of tensor project and clone it to local:
➜  tensorflow git:(master) git remote -v
origin	https://github.com/eigen2017/tensorflow (fetch)
origin	https://github.com/eigen2017/tensorflow (push)

4.set name and email:
git config user.name "eigen2017"
git config user.email "wobushiliu2@gmail.com"
be care not to add "global" option, so the git configuration is only for ur fork project , not for other git project on your pc.

5.change the source code

6. git add *
    git commit -m "..."
    git push origin master

7. grab a pull req from https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pulls
    select:  "compare across forks"
    select: your fork 

8. post the pull req
